result.title: C++: What is the best way to read a line containing of string followed by numbers ?
result.content:
Assume that your input is follows:

query 1 2
add -1 -1 1 1
query 1 2
delete 2
query 1 2
add -1 -1 101 101

based on your first word; you tend to read the remaining input. What is the best possible way to do the same?

I have tried the following and it doesnt work:

for(int i=1;i<=q;i++){        
        string ss;
        int a,b,c,d;
        getline(cin,ss,' ');        
        cout<<ss.length()<<" l "<<((ss=="query")?1:0)<<"\n";// but for some reason ss is never equal to "query" 
        if(ss=="query")
            cin>>a>>b;
        else if(ss=="add")
            cin>>a>>b>>c>>d;
        else if(ss=="delete")
            cin>>a;        
        cout<<ss<<"\n";
    }
